title: LA mDL Program Records (Jan 2023–Present)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Internal evaluation or pilot assessment reports that summarize performance, adoption, risks, or “lessons learned” from the LA Wallet (Go Validate/Envoc) program between January 1, 2023 and the present.

Agreements, contracts, or memoranda of understanding with vendors or partners, including but not limited to Go Validate, Envoc, IDEMIA, AAMVA, or other providers.

Interagency or interstate coordination documents, including but not limited to MOUs or correspondence with AAMVA or other states regarding mDL interoperability, standards development, or airport integration at Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Williams

title: 9/11 Records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: 9/11 Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I'm looking for records related to the events of September 11, 2001. Specifically the following:

1). All records pertaining to the property records of 'Flight 93' crash site, including any deeds, contracts, agreements, easements, written communications, and anything involving the owners which would include the surface owners Svonavec Inc. and easement/ coal mining rights to PBS Coals Inc., Mincorp Acquisitions Inc., and Citigroup. 

2). All photographs and video taken of 'Flight 93' crash site from the ground and air between September 11, 2001 and October 31, 2002.

Additionally, all photographs and video taken of the separate debris and debris fields at Indian Lake, PA and New Baltimore, PA between September 11, 2001 and October 31, 2002.


3). All records, such as, chain of custody logs, communications, document/ photography records, and current possession of 'Flight 93' debris that was located around Indian Lake, PA as indicated in The Daily American Fri, Sep 14, 2001 ·Page 12 where FBI Crowley speaks that on behalf of the investigation. John Fleegle is a local resident also mentioned in the same article that evidence was given to the FBI that was collected from Indian Lake. 

4). All records, such as, chain of custody logs, communications, document/ photography records, and current possession of 'Flight 93' debris that was located around New Baltimore, PA as indicated in Pittsburgh Post-Gazette Fri, Sep 14, 2001 ·Page 11 where FBI Crowley speaks that on behalf of the investigation. Andy Stoe, a local resident, also mentioned in the article that evidence of debris being scrap paper, an endorsed check, financial statements. On the Lowery Farm there was debris of financial documents scatter that were given to the FBI. In the Dayton Daily News Fri, Sep 14, 2001 Page 6, a local resident Melanie Hankinson found debris consisting of financial documents, an airline magazine, pilot handbook, and a few other stuff all confirmed by Agent Crowley of the FBI.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Kallas

title: FBI RECORDS MONTY MASSIMI

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI RECORDS MONTY MASSIMI
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation into Monty V. (Valentino) Massimi. 

Monty's DOD is April 3, 2007.  See: https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/buffalonews/name/monty-massimi-obituary?id=4686304 ... Also see: https://buffalonews.newspapers.com/article/the-buffalo-news-monty-massimi-obituary/148697516/

Monty is the son of Willis (AKA William, AKA Billy) V. Massimi and Joal Massimi who were married on 4/23/1960 and divorced in 1972.  See: https://buffalonews.newspapers.com/article/the-buffalo-news-monty-massimis-mother/180313982/

Willis Massimi's DOD was February 26, 2013.  See: https://buffalonews.newspapers.com/article/the-buffalo-news-obituary-for-willis-mas/180314346/  See also: https://buffalonews.com/obituaries/article_133442a6-951c-5138-865c-b4597cb04538.html

Please include any any all references to Monty's father Willis Massimi. 

Monty lived at the following addresses:
197 Lovering Ave, Buffalo, NY 14216
112 School St, Buffalo, NY 46213
4250 Ridge Lea Rd, Buffalo, NY 14226
860 Niagara Street, Buffalo, NY 46213
He also maintained a residence in Lockport, NY

Monty was murdered by Salvatore "Sam" M. Vacanti at Jacobi Restaurant.
See: https://buffalonews.newspapers.com/article/the-buffalo-news-monty-massimi-shot/148744554/
See Also: https://buffalonews.newspapers.com/article/the-buffalo-news-sam-vacanti-arrested-fo/148744717/
See Also: https://buffalonews.newspapers.com/article/the-buffalo-news-sam-vacantis-bail-revo/148744889/
For Police Report See Also: https://cdn.muckrock.com/foia_files/2022/06/29/vacanti.pdf

Additionally, Monty was close with LCN Figures:

1. Frank "Butch" BiFulco (Buffalo LCN Family). BiFulco's DOD is October 12, 2020. See: https://buffalonews.com/obituaries/frank-butch-bifulco-75-reputed-mobster-with-a-brilliant-mind/article_1165f678-1ab8-11eb-a55c-130105cb65b9.html See also: https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/buffalonews/name/frank-bifulco-obituary?id=4880120

2. Vincent "Jimmy" Caci (Los Angelos  LCN  Family). Caci's DOD is August 16, 2011. Attached is a picture of Monty Massimi with Vincent "Jimmy" Caci

3. Stephen Cino (Los Angelos LCN Family). Cino's DOD is March 11. 2013. See: https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/lvrj/name/stephen-cino-obituary?id=20533344

4. Anthony "Tony" Alessi (Buffalo LCN Family). Alessi's DOD is June 19, 2008. See: https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/buffalonews/name/anthony-alessi-obituary?id=4699991

6. John "Eyes" Mambrino (Buffalo LCN Family). John Mambrino's DOD is January 4, 2015. See: https://buffalonews.newspapers.com/article/the-buffalo-news-obituary-for-john-a-ma/167281899/

Please conduct a search for the above referenced records at the FBI Field Office in Buffalo, NY.

In addition to conducting this search for records at the FBI Field Office in Buffalo, NY, please conduct an additional search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to :

A. The Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices,

title: IHSC Folkston 911 SENs/SIRs

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: IHSC Folkston 911 SENs/SIRs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All Significant Event Notifications and Significant Incident Reports received by the IHSC Field Medical Coordinator or OAQ Contracting Officer pertaining to medical emergencies or 911 calls at the Folkston ICE Processing Center, and Annex, for the period beginning January 1, 2024, and continuing through September 3, 2025. 

I request expedited processing of this request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e) and declare the following statements in support thereof to be true and correct under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746: 

1. Folkston is now the largest ICE detention facility in Georgia. 
2. Following the preventable death of Jaspal Singh in 2023, ICE rewarded Folkston's operator, GEO, with an expansion of the Folkston contract worth over $100M
3. In 2025, Folkston was the site of a second in-custody death. 
4. Logs of 911 calls reflect instances in which EMS units were unavailable to gain timely access to the facility as a result of GEO staff's inability to consistently man the sally ports and entryways to secure areas, delaying emergency care for people inside. 
5. Lack of access to timely emergency medical care threatens the health safety of people in Folkston and the surrounding community. 
6. ICE Mortality Reviewers have attributed lack of timely access to emergency medical care to a significant number of deaths in ICE custody. 
7. The records requested will shed light on whether, and to what extent, ICE is aware of the challenges posed and consequences created by its use of detention in high numbers at the Folkston facility. 
8. I am a member of the media primarily engaged in information dissemination through edited publications, and have previously been granted expedited processing by federal FOIA offices on this basis. 
9. These records are needed on an expedited basis to fill out the federal side of a piece for which I have received journalism grant funding and which will be published no later than October.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

BRYANT MACHOWSKI

title: First Amendment Trainings for Law-Enforcement Officers (Baltimore Police Department)

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: First Amendment Trainings for Law-Enforcement Officers (Baltimore Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any materials or programming (including handouts, slideshows, videos, textbooks, or other media) used in connection with providing training or guidance to law-enforcement officers in your agency with respect to any of the following subjects: (a) The First Amendment; (b) protests or demonstrations; (c) freedom of speech or expression; (d) filming police officers. This request is limited to materials used in trainings since January 1, 2020.

2. Any policy concerning whether trainings on the topics mentioned in (1) are mandatory, or regulating the frequency of such trainings.

3. A copy of any document sufficient to show the most recent training conducted for law-enforcement officers in your agency with respect to any of the subjects in (1). For example, this could be a receipt or contract for an outside vendor or speaker, or it could be a dated sign-in sheet from the training.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: UMaine U

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: UMaine U
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

All electronic communications between Senator Susan Collins and/or representatives of her office and members of the University President and her cabinet. The purpose of this request is to elucidate an elected official's actions leading up to the recent congressional spending bill passed in July and its effects on the University of Maine. 

In order to narrow this search, please query the email addresses of Jenny Boyden, Kody Varahramyan, James S. Ward IV, Jeffery Mills, Gabriel Paquette, Nicole Lawrence, John Diamond, Kevin Coughlin, and Jenny Boyden, for the following strings: "Susan Collins", "Senator Collins", "Sen. Collins" in addition to any emails containing the domain "@mail.house.gov". Additionally, please limit your search to the inclusive range of 5/1/25-7/30/25.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daniel Boguslaw

communications.subject: Re: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: UMaine U
communications.communication:
Hello,



I am writing to acknowledge your Maine Freedom of Access (FOAA) request
dated September 2, 2025. This email will serve as the 5 working day
confirmation of your request under 1 MRSA §408-A(3).



Research and collection of records responsive to your request are currently
being conducted. We will shortly reach out if we have any questions
regarding the scope of your request and provide you with an estimated time
when you may expect records to be released. We will also let you know if
there is to be a fee charged and whether it will exceed $30. If you would
like to further clarify the scope of your request or have any additional
questions, please do not hesitate to reach out.
Regards,



Mary Pettegrow

Paralegal

Office of the General Counsel

University of Maine System

title: ALPR Audit Metadata Records FOIA (Lincolnwood Police Department)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: ALPR Audit Metadata Records FOIA (Lincolnwood Police Department)
communications.communication:
Re: ALPR Audit Metadata Records FOIA

To the Lincolnwood Police Department FOIA Officer,

This request is made under the provisions of Illinois Freedom of Information Act. for the following records:

1. All Flock Safety ALPR “Organization Audit” and “Network Audit” records logged between January 1, 2024, and the date this request is processed where the “Reason” field contains any of the following terms (case-insensitive):

“Immigration”
“ICE”
“HSI”
“Homeland Security”
“DHS”
“usbp”

2. All Flock Safety ALPR “Network Audit” records logged between January 1, 2024, and the date this request is processed where the “Org Name” field contains any of the following terms (case-insensitive):

“U.S. Border Patrol” or “US Border Patrol [Federal]”
“Palos Heights IL PD”
“Johnson County TX SO“
“Texas Department of Public Safety”

Both the “Organization Audit” and “Network Audit” are available within the Insights tab of the Flock Safety system. Please redact in full the “License Plate” column, I am not requesting that data. The agency may redact or omit that column in its entirety. The remaining fields requested such as Name, Org Name, Reason, and Search Time consist solely of administrative metadata documenting system use. 

Clarifications Regarding Scope and Burden

Not burdensome: 
This request is narrowly tailored. It does not seek every audit entry, only those containing the short list of immigration-related keywords. While there may be many more terms and variations used for immigration searches, we are keeping this list short and explicit to avoid a burdensome request. The requested records are produced automatically by the Flock Safety system in spreadsheet form. Filtering the “Reason” column for a limited set of keywords is a routine data filtering operation. 

Not categorical: 
This request is narrowly tailored. It seeks only those audit entries where the “Reason” field contains any of the specific immigration-related terms provided in the short list above. It does not encompass all audit records or broad categories of data.

Not exempt under § 2-130: 
Audit logs are administrative records documenting system use,  such as the identity of the user, the time of access, and the stated reason for the search. With the exception of the “License Plate” column (which can be omitted), these logs do not fall within the statutory definition of “ALPR information” under 625 ILCS 5/2-130. They are oversight metadata, not raw surveillance outputs.

Compelling public interest:
The Illinois TRUST Act (5 ILCS 805) and the Way Forward Act (Public Act 102-0234) explicitly prohibit local law enforcement from engaging in federal civil immigration enforcement.

625 ILCS 5/2-130 restricts the use of ALPR systems for immigration enforcement and limits secrecy around ALPR oversight.

The Illinois Secretary of State has launched a statewide investigation into ALPRs, including how they are used for immigration criminalization*. This underscores the importance of these public audit records and the clear public interest in disclosing the requested records.

Some recent public reporting on local ALPRs includes:

ICE Taps into Nationwide AI-Enabled Camera Network, Data Shows
<https://web.archive.org/web/20250527141200/https://www.404media.co/ice-taps-into-nationwide-ai-enabled-camera-network-data-shows/>

DEA agent used Illinois cop’s Flock license plate reader password for immigration enforcement searches
<https://web.archive.org/web/20250811191507/https://unraveledpress.com/a-dea-agent-used-an-illinois-police-officers-flock-license-plate-reader-password-for-unauthorized-immigration-enforcement-searches/>

Feds Used Local Cop's Password to Do Immigration Surveillance With Flock Cameras
<https://web.archive.org/web/20250812151424/https://www.404media.co/feds-used-local-cops-password-to-do-immigration-surveillance-with-flock-cameras/>

CBP Had Access to More than 80,000 Flock AI Cameras Nationwide
<https://web.archive.org/web/20250902190711/https://www.404media.co/cbp-had-access-to-more-than-80-000-flock-ai-cameras-nationwide/>

Flock Safety license plate camera company stops cooperating with federal agencies over investigation concerns
<https://web.archive.org/web/20250902193429/https://www.cbsnews.com/chicago/news/flock-safety-license-plate-company-federal-agencies-cooperation/>

Finally, it is important to note that the very data being withheld from the public is already uploaded in full to a private data broker, where it is stored in proprietary off-site systems and made available to Flock Safety system users. This practice constitutes an enclosure of public data collected without the consent of those targeted by municipal surveillance weapons. The public interest is evident and the request is clearly within the scope of FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you for your assistance. I anticipate your response within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Niles Coalition

Footnotes:

*Giannoulias Cracks Down on Unlawful Use of License Plate Reader Data
<https://web.archive.org/web/20250702121007/https://www.ilsos.gov/news/2025/june/250612d1.pdf>

*Giannoulias’ Audit Finds License Plate Reader Company in Violation of State Law
<https://web.archive.org/web/20250902182146/https://www.ilsos.gov/news/2025/august/250825d1.pdf>

Finally, it is important to note that the very data being withheld from the public is already uploaded in full to a private data broker, where it is stored in proprietary off-site systems and made available to Flock Safety system users. This practice constitutes an enclosure of public data collected without the consent of those targeted by municipal surveillance weapons. The public interest is evident and the request is clearly within the scope of FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you for your assistance. I anticipate your response within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Niles Coalition

Footnotes:

*Giannoulias Cracks Down on Unlawful Use of License Plate Reader Data
<https://web.archive.org/web/20250702121007/https://www.ilsos.gov/news/2025/june/250612d1.pdf>

*Giannoulias’ Audit Finds License Plate Reader Company in Violation of State Law
<https://web.archive.org/web/20250902182146/https://www.ilsos.gov/news/2025/august/250825d1.pdf>

title: Police disciplinary files

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Police disciplinary files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
